forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 53. West southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 66, with temperatures falling to around 64 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 5 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 24 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the night has given way to a serene morning with the sky wrapped in a gentle blanket of clouds, harboring a refreshing coolness in the air. Presently, the temperature rests around a manageable fifty-three degrees, accompanied by a soft west-southwest breeze that whispers through the streets—creating an inviting atmosphere for a morning stroll. As the sun rises higher, it is expected to unveil a sunny tableau, reaching a pleasant high near sixty-six. The warmth will gradually mingle with the coolness of the bay, particularly in the afternoon when the temperature dips slightly, indicating a classic San Francisco day.

Though there are hints of the marine layer preparing to retreat, its presence remains a subtle reminder of the city's unique climate. One can glimpse the fog retreating, likely clinging closer to the coastline, as if reluctant to relinquish its hold. As the day unfolds into clearer skies, those venturing outside will find themselves in the gentle embrace of a refreshing wind, perfect for layered dressing—perhaps a light jacket over a tee to accommodate the shifting warmth. With such delightful weather gracing the city, a visit to one of the neighborhood cafés for a warm beverage or a leisurely walk to admire the architecture and bustling life of the streets would be a cherished way to savor this splendid Thursday.
